name: King Charles III England Coast Path: Allonby to Whitehaven

ai.summary: A demanding 90.6 km stretch of the England Coast Path from Allonby to Whitehaven, tracing Cumbria's rugged western coastline. This multi-day coastal trek combines long exposed shorelines with climbs over grassy ridges, offering dramatic sea views, remote sections, and opportunities to pass through villages along the route.
ai.terrain_summary: Rugged coastal terrain featuring cliff-top paths, stony tracks, and occasional beach or muddy sections. Expect strong winds, sea spray, uneven footing, and notable elevation changes as you cross headlands and coves along exposed coastlines.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for multi-day travel with daylight and weather considerations. Watch out for cliff edges, rockfalls, and slippery surfaces; tides can affect beach sections. The route is remote with limited services in places, and mobile coverage may be unreliable. Carry navigation tools, inform someone of your itinerary, and check tide times and weather forecasts before starting each day.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof hiking boots with good grip
Breathable base layers and mid layers
Map, compass, and offline GPS or navigation app
Fully charged phone with offline maps and a power bank
First aid kit and any personal medications
Water bottles or hydration system (at least 2 L total) and snacks
Dry bags or waterproof stuff sacks
Tent or bivy sack and sleeping bag (if overnighting)
Emergency whistle and personal safety device
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–September) are typically the best windows for this coastal route due to milder weather and longer daylight. It can be hiked outside this period with proper gear and planning.

seo.title: King Charles III England Coast Path: Allonby to Whitehaven – 90.6 km Coastal Hike
seo.meta_description: Explore 90.6 km of rugged UK coastline on the King Charles III England Coast Path from Allonby to Whitehaven. Trail terrain, safety, and gear guide for this hard coastal trek.
